ygData.messageBody:
Playing my wizard, soloing spectres, sand giants in oasis waiting for
my friends to log on. I use levitate to help move across the terrain.
Floating above the water, killing spectres my levitate begins to fade.
I recast, and get the "You are already floating" message. Now I have
a couple options, run up to the spectre island to recast, which has
the chance of drawing more spectres to me, or run back across the
water to recast. Standing over a lava pit when levitate starts to fade?
Running across the ocean of tears and levitate fades? Swim to an
island. The problem with the bard will be fixed, other
classes have been nerfed.

My levitate lasts just over 15 minutes, so when my leader is pulling
cyclops for us, I like to keep levitate up on him so he can pull
better. Now levitate has to be out before I can recast, or I have
to tell him to drop it, then wait for him to respond, then recast.

They have definitely found a very rude way to fix a very small problem.

I have heard that the same problem exists with enduring breath also,
which I haven't been able to verify. Can you imagine having this
go out in Kedge? You would have to recast aftr it fades while you are
running out of breath, how fun.

> From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
> > Yes it is broken for all classes, but... The other classes still have a
> > usuable spell, while our song is completely worthless till they fix it.
>
> I don't understand why you all think it's broken for casters?
> They cannot cast levitate on themselves while they are already
> levitating - so what? They never did that before, that I can
> tell. You lose lev, remem lev, and recast lev. The only person
> I saw jamming on levitate like 50 times was a GM to make him rise
> high above anyone. And it's my belief why they attempted to
> correct levitate due to the people who would levitate themselves
> over and over to heights where they could easily overcome obstacles.
> (The ledge in Permafrost to Lady Vox comes to mind)
>
> Harmonic.
